content.webTitle: Teacher charged with indecent assault on boys

fields.headline: Teacher charged with indecent assault on boys
fields.bodyText: A primary school teacher has been charged with 25 offences of indecent assault against boys over a period of 22 years, police said today. Graham Stride, who teaches at a Roman Catholic school in Hampshire, was arrested on Saturday and charged with the offences. They allegedly involved boys aged under 16 and under 14 and took place between 1982 and February 2004. The 49 year old, of Elson, Gosport, who has been suspended from his job, is due to appear before Fareham magistrates court tomorrow. Barry Hudd, spokesman for Portsmouth's Catholic bishop, Crispian Hollis, said: "The diocese is aware that a teacher in one of its schools has been charged with a number of offences of indecent assault. "We are shocked and saddened by this but at this time we do not have sufficient information to comment further on the matter."
